Peaceful Revolution: If all humans suddenly became pacifists, it could lead to a peaceful revolution where violence is no longer used as a means of resolving conflicts. This could result in a world where people work together towards common goals without resorting to aggression or war.

New World Order: The sudden shift towards pacifism could also lead to the formation of a new world order, where countries and regions work together for mutual benefit rather than competing against each other. This could result in a more harmonious global community that prioritizes peace and cooperation over conflict and aggression.

Human Unity: With the elimination of violence as a means of conflict resolution, humans would be able to focus on their shared humanity and work towards building a better future for everyone. This could result in increased unity among different cultures, religions, and ethnicities, leading to a more inclusive and diverse society.

Environmental Preservation: A world without violence could also lead to a greater emphasis on environmental preservation, as resources would no longer be wasted on military hardware and warfare. Instead, people would have more time and energy to devote to sustainable practices and conservation efforts, resulting in a healthier planet for future generations.

Global Harmony: Finally, a world without violence could lead to a greater sense of global harmony, as people from different parts of the world would be able to come together and work towards common goals without fear of conflict or aggression. This could result in a more peaceful and prosperous world for all, free from the destructive effects of war and conflict.
